intro: Leucadendron cuneiforme, commonly known as the silver coin bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its conical, silver-gray leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often used in coastal gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. The species is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
